revised_title: Fermi Surface Anisotropy in Alkali Metals: The de Haas-van Alphen Effect
tldr: The authors developed a new method to study the de Haas-van Alphen effect in alkali metals using steady magnetic fields. They found that the Fermi surfaces of potassium and rubidium are nearly spherical, with departures from sphericity of about 1% for potassium and slightly less for rubidium. These results are compared to band structure calculations, providing insights into the behavior of these materials under magnetic fields.
